result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
Arrest Warrant is body only -  good for the State of WI only.
Defendant Jeffrey M. Jacobs not in court. Veronica F Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BTC:  Bond is forfeited and Arrest Warrant is body only good for the State of WI.

DA Case #14PT679
Court calls case at   1:28 p.m.
ADA Isherwood appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Atty Drury special appearance.  Defendant doesn't qualify for public defender.
Court informs of rights to have an attorney.
ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Substantial Battery.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court questions the defendant.
State requests a cash bond:  No contact with Lori Parent.   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Atty Drury makes statements.
Victim is not present today.

BTC:  $750 cash bond:  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment. Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Lori Parent.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:   04-14-14  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3
